intro: Tecoma sambucifolia, commonly known as the Mexican trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces long, pendulous inflorescences. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Tecoma sambucifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
